  1. ADFS 2.0 Claims Incomplete or Wrong on username change.

    If you use AD FS 2.0, then you may have run across an issue before where after the username has been changed things do not come back correctly. This could be where you see fewer claims coming back and including the Windows Account Name shows the previous name. This is a because of caching performed by the LSA service, and as a result the old information gets used. Changing a persons account name is not uncommon, such as a person changing their name for marriage, so this fix should keep you running in those cases. …

    5 Jul 2012 • on

  5. UVerse TV and the case of the bloats.

    So in a normal brain fart moment, I failed to remember several of my own teachings when adding a second Access Point to my home network. You see, I have ATT UVerse TV service at home, and for those who don’t remember it uses IGMP to multicast the TV feeds to the receivers. So if you for example, have a receiver plugged directly into the 2Wire modem, it will send the traffic out that port. Now, if you have that receiver plugged into a switch and share the drop with other devices it still comes down that line, however the switch more than likely does not understand multicast. Unless you have a more expensive device in there that is. …

    24 Nov 2011 • on
